40#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
41# include "config.h"
42#endif
43
44#include <sys/cdefs.h>
45__RCSID("$NetBSD: pam_putenv.c,v 1.3 2017/05/06 19:50:10 christos Exp $");
46
47#include <errno.h>
48#include <stdlib.h>
49#include <string.h>
50
51#include <security/pam_appl.h>
52
53#include "openpam_impl.h"
54
55/*
56 * XSSO 4.2.1
57 * XSSO 6 page 56
58 *
59 * Set the value of an environment variable
60 */
61
62int
63pam_putenv(pam_handle_t *pamh,
64 const char *namevalue)
65{
66 char **env, *p;
67 size_t env_size;
68 int i;
69
70 ENTER();
71
72 /* sanity checks */
73 if ((p = strchr(namevalue, '=')) == NULL) {
74 errno = EINVAL;
75 RETURNC(PAM_SYSTEM_ERR);
76 }
77
78 /* see if the variable is already in the environment */
79 if ((i = openpam_findenv(pamh, namevalue,
80 (size_t)(p - namevalue))) >= 0) {
81 if ((p = strdup(namevalue)) == NULL)
82 RETURNC(PAM_BUF_ERR);
83 FREE(pamh->env[i]);
84 pamh->env[i] = p;
85 RETURNC(PAM_SUCCESS);
86 }
87
88 /* grow the environment list if necessary */
89 if (pamh->env_count == pamh->env_size) {
90 env_size = pamh->env_size * 2 + 1;
91 env = realloc(pamh->env, sizeof(*env) * env_size);
92 if (env == NULL)
93 RETURNC(PAM_BUF_ERR);
94 pamh->env = env;
95 pamh->env_size = env_size;
96 }
97
98 /* add the variable at the end */
99 if ((pamh->env[pamh->env_count] = strdup(namevalue)) == NULL)
100 RETURNC(PAM_BUF_ERR);
101 ++pamh->env_count;
102 RETURNC(PAM_SUCCESS);
103}
104
105/*
106 * Error codes:
107 *
108 * PAM_SYSTEM_ERR
109 * PAM_BUF_ERR
110 */
111
112/**
113 * The =pam_putenv function sets an environment variable.
114 * Its semantics are similar to those of =putenv, but it modifies the PAM
115 * context's environment list instead of the application's.
116 *
117 * >pam_getenv
118 * >pam_getenvlist
119 * >pam_setenv
120 */
121
